In this game, it is best to open exactly one box. The expected number of points is highest if you open exactly one box because if that box does not contain the bomb, you earn 1 point, and if it does contain the bomb, you still have a chance to earn points by opening additional boxes. 

Let's say you open n boxes and none of them contain the bomb. The expected number of points you will earn is n*(1/100) + (100-n)*(n/100) = n + (100-n)*(n/100).

To maximize the expected number of points, you want to maximize the expression n + (100-n)*(n/100). 

Taking the derivative of this expression with respect to n and setting it equal to zero, we find that the maximum expected value is obtained when n = [1].

So, the optimal strategy is to open just one box.
